Name: Deploy SSRS Reports from a package
Description:
Uploads SSRS reports to an SSRS server from a package.

The following Datasource properties can be overidden: ConnectionString, Username, Password, and CredentialRetrieval (valid values are: Integrated, Prompt, Store, or None).  To override the property, create a Variable using the syntax of DatasourceName.PropertyName.  For example: MyDatasource.Username 

To specify the Username and Password are Windows Credentials, create a variable called DatasourceName.WindowsCredentials and set the value to the string value 'true' (minus the quotes).
Author: twerthi

Parameters.Name: NugetPackageStepName
Parameters.Label: SSRS package step
Parameters.HelpText: Select the step in this project which downloads the SSRS package.

Parameters.Name: ReportServiceUrl
Parameters.Label: Url of SSRS Server service
Parameters.HelpText:
The complete Url to the SSRS server.
Example: http://198.239.216.46/ReportServer_LOCALDEV/reportservice2010.asmx?wsdl

Parameters.Name: ReportExecutionUrl
Parameters.Label: Report Execution Url
Parameters.HelpText:
The complete Url to the Report Execution service.
Example: http://198.239.216.46/ReportServer_LOCALDEV/ReportExecution2005.asmx?wsdl

Parameters.Name: ReportFolder
Parameters.Label: Report folder
Parameters.HelpText: Relative Url to the folder in which the reports will be deployed.

Parameters.Name: ReportDatasourceFolder
Parameters.Label: Report data source folder
Parameters.HelpText: Relative Url where the data sources for the reports are located, starting with '/'

Parameters.Name: OverwriteDataSources
Parameters.Label: Overwrite datasource(s)
Parameters.HelpText: Tick if the existing report data source file needs to e replaced.

Parameters.Name: BackupLocation
Parameters.Label: Backup Location
Parameters.HelpText: Directory path to take a backup of existing reports (.rdl) and data source (.rds) files.

Parameters.Name: ReportDataSetFolder
Parameters.Label: DataSet folder
Parameters.HelpText: Relative Url where Shared Data Sets are stored

Parameters.Name: ReportPartsFolder
Parameters.Label: Report Parts Folder
Parameters.HelpText: Relative folder where Report Parts are uploaded to.

Parameters.Name: ServiceUserDomain
Parameters.Label: Service Domain
Parameters.HelpText: (Optional - leave blank to use Tentacle identity) Name of the domain for the user account to execute as

Parameters.Name: ServiceUserName
Parameters.Label: Service Username
Parameters.HelpText: (Optional - leave blank to use Tentacle identity) Username of the user account to execute as

Parameters.Name: ServicePassword
Parameters.Label: Service Password
Parameters.HelpText: (Optional - leave blank to use Tentacle identity) Password of the user account to execute as

Parameters.Name: ClearReportFolder
Parameters.Label: Clear the Report Folder
Parameters.HelpText: Optional - This will delete all items in the Report Folder before adding items.

Parameters.Name: UseArchiveStructure
Parameters.Label: Use package folder structure
Parameters.HelpText: Tick this box to create folders matching the package folder structure and upload items into their respective folders.  Ticking this box ignores all other folder specifications except Root folder

Parameters.Name: RootFolder
Parameters.Label: Root folder
Parameters.HelpText: Used only when 'Use package folder structure' is checked.  This specifies the root folder on SSRS to start in.  Value is relative so it begins with a /
